intro: Pedicularis khoiyangii, commonly known as the Khoiyang's lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the Himalayas. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many hemiparasitic species. The plant has hairy, erect stems and produces showy, spurred flowers in shades of red and purple. Its roots are adapted to absorb nutrients from host plants, reflecting its parasitic nature. It thrives in high-altitude environments and is often found in rocky or alpine habitats.
